column5: Thanks everyone for all of the info you have been sharing. I feel sorry that some of you with early trips had a tough go of it so far.
ice went out on the 21st - fishing is horrible - should be good by the 7th - they are just starting to spawn now.
Any Reports on the water level?
Same question. Also, I appreciate the updates everyone has been posting about the ice out and conditions. Thanks
You can contact the AFC
Our group got an update from Norman at Air Mt-Laurier today. Here is his quote: "Water level is very high. The dam had to be closed so the south would not be flooded. "
Full! Nuff said! FT
2017 full?
Water is very close to 2017 levels, maybe about 6 inches lower. Water was still very cold, fishing should get better by the day.
I’m headed up Jun22-29 hopefully hitting it at a good time this year!
Well, it's that time. Lot's of clouds lately but Reservoir Baskatong is now ice free. Lac Saint-Jean is starting to show signs of thawing too. Come on Mr, Sun shine on!!!!! FT
That's Lake Simcoe.....Sent from my SM-A530W using Tapatalk
Satelite map I was glancing at shows everything frozen North of St Lawrence?
U R Correct. I wish we could delete are mistakes...oh well. It's almost gone too! FT
I will say ice out on May 26th for the Gouin.
Gouin still has lots of ice on it as of yesterday - like 12 - 16 inches Mattawa Bay is solid in the middle. We are heading up on the 16th for the opener with snow shoes
Motard River on the Gouin today. Galette River still under ice Motard: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=emmCjkEFh-k#
Ice is hanging on at the Gouin and snow on the roads is still an issue. Bummer for the opener today. FT
Mattawa Bay Today - hopefully we will have the boats in on Sunday.
Hope you get t do some fishing soon enough! Were you ab’e To get on the water?We’re headed up to mattawa on the 7th
